definition: to play tricks/to maneuver
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
surname Shua
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
wrist/(squid, starfish etc) arm
to play tricks/to play at politics

toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth

two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
art of politics/political tricks (often derog.)/power play/to play at politics/underhand trickery

scheming/shrewdness
